text.text: impact grenades have a low blast radius but are much more effective against vehicles than frag grenades
radar structures jam radio signals within a 100m radius
Structures with a lot of health points are best destroyed with C4
if you have enough resource points (RP) it's wise to buy a vest
too much encumbrance in your backpack will make your accuracy suffer a lot
cover is your best friend, use it as often as you can
diving away from a grenade can save your life
stabbing an enemy gives you much more XP than shooting him
backdooring a base can be a good way to break a stalemate
Flanking a base can be a good way to break a stalemate
to capture a base, enter the dotted area which is visible on the map
Capturing a base requires a 2/3 majority of troops to begin the timer
Machineguns need you to go prone before fire, unless behind cover
Stun grenades have a large blast radius but don't kill
In a campaign, you can only respawn with your faction's weapons, unless you unlocked other faction's weapons
To unlock enemy weapons for your own faction, bring a few of them to an armory
Vehicles are easy targets to large groups of infantry, use them carefully
Don't let your own deaths bring you down, in RWR You will die a lot
There are no 'better' guns, each fulfills a different purpose and at a price
Shooting single shots helps a lot in reducing bullet spread
Spotting enemy vehicles is an easy way to gain RP
Selling valuables that are dropped by dead soldiers can be worth the trip
A vest Type-II absorbs 2 bullets, the third puts you in a wounded state
A camouflage suit doesn't protect you but makes you harder to detect by the AI
Some heavier weapons lower your movement speed
The commander gives attack orders - you are free to do whatever you want, though
Only soldiers who wore a vest can be revived with the medikit
If you're wounded and can't get help, hold the melee key to force respawn
